headline: Cream of Mushroom Soup
description: Cream of mushroom soup is a favorite, and this recipe makes a classic one. Use any mushrooms you like: button, shiitake, cremini, or wild all work great.

video.description: See how to make rich, creamy mushroom soup from scratch.
video.name: Cream of Mushroom Soup I

name: Cream of Mushroom Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer mushrooms, broth, onion, and thyme in a large heavy saucepan until vegetables are tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
Carefully transfer the hot mixture to a blender or food processor. Cover and hold lid down with a potholder; pulse until creamy but still with some chunks of vegetable.
Melt butter in the same saucepan. Whisk in flour until smooth. Whisk in salt and pepper. Slowly whisk in half-and-half and mushroom mixture.
Bring soup to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Stir in sherry. Taste and season with salt and pepper if needed.

review.reviewBody: Honestly, it was super bland. I ended up adding garlic, extra thyme, extra salt, cumin, and basil. I also added celery and only blended half or so. The color doesn't look anything like the picture at the end.

Added 1 clove of pressed garlic, did not blend/puree mushrooms. I used a small mezzaluna to break up the mushrooms into smaller bite size pieces. Used the half & half as suggested. Also used better than bouillon chicken instead of broth, 1 tablespoon per cup of hot water. Perfect!

Wow! Rather easy to make and instead of salt or pepper I placed a small amount of another all season herbs. My husband gave it the best soup I've ever made, and I really liked it too. Excellent! I will be making it again and again.
Flavor was okay but this was so thick. Doesn't look anywhere near the picture. It was more like a porridge than a soup. Needed way more salt than specified. Definitely not impressed

Recipe turned out pretty well. I question the serving size to make 6 servings. That is probably true if you think of a small restaurant cup of soup. If you're sitting down and it is the majority of your meal, I'd call it 3 servings as written. I did not puree the entire batch of broth, mushrooms, and onions. I did about half and liked that approach. I wanted some discernible pieces of mushrooms and onions in the soup. End result was very thick as written. My husband was calling it gravy. I would probably use more broth/stock next time. I added water to leftovers to get it back to a creamy soup consistency.

This is pretty solid. My picky 14-year old even ate it. I chose this particular recipe because of cooking the veggies in the broth. I normally wouldn’t but my mushrooms from the store were the dirtiest I’ve ever seen, and so I found it necessary to wash them in a strainer instead of just dry-brushing them clean.

This was a decent cream of mushroom soup, but it was underseasoned. It needed more salt and pepper. I did not like the texture of the soup, so I puréed it into a true cream of mushroom soup. To add more flavor to the soup I sauté the onions and the mushrooms separately and then added the onions to the mushroom stock pot. Then continued with the recipe.
Delicious. I forgot to buy cream. Took the advice of other reviews and added some cream cheese to the recipe. I tried a bit before blending and it was great as is.

I sautéed the mushrooms and onions in a little bit of butter for a few minutes then added the thyme, continued to sauté for a couple minutes before adding the broth. Didn't have any sherry but it's delicious without it.

holy moly! just like a fancy restaurant! the only change was used half & half instead of heavy cream and used an immersion blender and just blended about half. I held back some mushrooms and added those at the end. (I like a little more texture). Also added two large garlic cloves with the onion. super quick and exactly what a cold fall night needs. thanks!
I cooked it a little too long, so it was thicker than it should have been. Needed a LOT of salt and pepper.

I usually make new recipes as written, but cooking the mushrooms and onion in boullion didn't sound very appealing, so I fried them first. However, I realized after frying them, that it really didn't make a difference, as I didn't carmelize the onions, and the volume of mushrooms meant they didn't brown either, so next time I will cook them in the stock as the recipe says. Much less work! I accidentally put in more mushrooms than asked for, probably a good two cups worth, so when fully pureed it was thick enough, so I didn't thicken with flour. I accidentally used milk instead of full cream, but because I had extra mushrooms, I still added half the amount of cream to partially make up for it. Despite my ineptitude, the soup was quite delicious. I may never eat canned soup again! Next time I will follow the recipe exactly and update my review then. My apologies to the recipe creator for messing up your very easy recipe. I clearly was off my game, but the soup still turned out to be delicious.
This recipe is delicious. The only change I make is omitting the sherry. The directions are easy to follow. My family eats this soup very quickly.
Make this exact to the recipe with no changes. Wonderful soup thank you!
i left the mushrooms in larger pices instead of pureing the soup
Delicious. I've made it repeatedly. Today I used oyster mushrooms instead. Just as good as always.
Excellent recipe! Can make this Keto friendly by using cream cheese instead of flour to thicken.
My family and I love this recipe. My granddaughter is allergic to gluten so I use this soup in tuna casserole. A double hit. I thicken with cornstarch instead of flour to make it gluten free.
I used cream not half n half and no sherry in the house but it was FANTASTIC. The flavor was mega.

Great!
I adjusted using almond flour and oat milk and adding some cooked chicken at the end.
A wonderful warm dinner.
This was sooooo good!!! Loved it. I didn't puree the mushroom mix. I like the small chunks for texture.
Delicious!
Tremendous. I created an account just to rate it. I should mention I did add a decent sized clove of garlic to the sautéing but other than that stayed right to rhe recipe and it kicks .
Excellent, good 'ole fashioned, cream of mushroom soup.
This soup was excellent as easy to make. Only problem with recipe was it made a small amount. Will double next time..
This soup turned out DELICIOUS!! I doubled the recipe and used an immersion blender to blend half of the mushroom mixture.
I didn’t have cream but this is the very best recipe for this soup that I’ve ever used.

I really like this soup. I ended up using a restaurant mix of mushrooms (bella, shitake, oyster) which made for a great flavor.

Unless i missing it, what is the actual serving size? 1/2c? its doesnt really say. just that there are 6 servings

Made this tonight and it turned out really good. 

**I substituted Coconut Flour for the AP flour with no issue (added slightly more butter) and added a mushroom umami spice and will definitely make this again!

Great feedback from the family! Next time I will try it with portobello instead of crimini...and I will add more chicken broth to make it less thick as per request. Tasters were cream of mushroom connoisseurs and they loved the taste! So...great recipe!
made it twice last month, loved it so much. I reconstituted dried mushrooms that I had on hand. It was awesome
Great soup, even without the cream. I added two cloves of minced garlic. It’s wonderful for the soup lovers in your family!

I used this for my wild rice soup instead of the store-bought soup because it's loaded with salt. This is delicious and so easy. I used two 8oz baby bellas and chopped them finely and used one cup whipping cream instead of half n' half. I also found reduced-sodium beef broth. 1/2 t pepper, 1/2 t thyme, and 1/4 crushed red pepper to add a bit more flavor. It's a keeper!!!

Absolutely love this recipe just the way it is. I agree with other reviewer ‘s. I wish people would stop changing the recipe in their review. If you’re going to change it and not just review it as is please take the time to submit your own if you’re adding or substituting ingredients. Tips are great but when you’re changing so much it’s a whole different recipe. Love this recipe and thank you to the person who submitted it just the way it is.

Followed directions to the T and it came out perfect! I would not change anything. 
A very delicious, rustic, comfort food. Perfect for our upcoming snowy Colorado day!
We just paid $8 for a cup of this at a local eatery. Recipe tastes exactly the same. I added a little nutmeg. YUM.
Delicious! I used a whole bunch of different kinds of mushrooms and the flavour was awesome! No modifications needed.
Excellent recipe!!
Delicious creamy soup. I didn’t purée all the mushrooms as we like some chunks. I did t have any sherry so added red wine vinegar. I’ll make this again.
Very creamy rich soup just as the recipe is written. My family loves garlic so I did add a few cloves and some Cajun seasoning for a little bite.
Wasn't sure I'd like this but WOWZA! It's my new favorite soup! Thank you!

Delicious! Next time I will double the recipe. I also used my immersion blender and left it a little junky rather than just creamy. I like to really taste the mushrooms. I also nuked the butter, added the flour to make a roux and then added the milk. Then I added all that to the soup. I added a bit more S&P and sherry. My husband LOVED it!
Loved it
Excellent soup! Definitely a keeper and very easy to make!
Delicious! I did not have Sherry so I used some Brandy instead. Fabulous!
It’s delicious!
This is an easy, terrific soup. I made it in the morning before I went to work to give the flavors time to blend. What a wonderful meal to come home to. I will definitely make it again and again!
The recipe is good. Delicious. The only thing is the portions. 6 servings is equal to 2 persons.
I found it boring
Mushroom soup is one of our favorites. This recipe did not disappoint

We enjoyed it so much I've made it twice this month. We didn't like the muddy appearance of pureed mushrooms, so I skipped step 2 the second time. I also browned the mushrooms for extra flavor. My only problem was too much roux for us. It was so thick we could've eaten it with a fork. It took quite a bit more chicken stock to reach soup consistency. Next time, I think I'll reduce the amount of butter & flour by half.

Very good. I sautéed onions. In a little butter 5 minutes. Then cooked mushrooms 5 minutes in with onions then added broth and cooked 10 minutes. I puréed half of the mushroom mixture. A delicious soup
I used milk in stead of cream just because I did not have cream. It turned out great! Thanks for the recipe.
I made this today on my way to making Tater Tot Casserole. I used portobello mushrooms. I sautéed the onions and mushrooms then pureed half with the chicken broth. The soup is delicious.
Absolutely delicious. I did sauté the onions and mushrooms first and reserved half of the vegies before the purée as suggested

I've been making this for years it's really good. I increased the broth a little and I saute the mushrooms and onions with a clove of garlic first. I didn't have Sherry so I added white wine. It is always delicious!
perfect and it works with rice milk to make it non-dairy! thank you!

Great recipe full of creamy mushroom goodness! I used all of the ingredients as written and it was delicious! Instead of just adding the flour, butter and milk to the shrooms, I did a light roux with the flour and butter, adding the half and half before transferring that to the stock pot with the veggies and broth. I also have an immersion blender so I took a couple of ladles of mushrooms out of the pot before puréeing the rest, adding them back at the end for some texture. So good! Thanks for the recipe!

So good!
I didn’t have sherry, so obviously I didn’t add it, I did add fresh garlic because I add it to just about everything.
Very good and easy. Hubby loved it, made it last week, making second batch today.
Thanksgiving around the corner, thinking of using this for green bean casserole instead of canned!

I did make some changes but mostly used fancy mushroom and added a fine white ground Sarawak pepper.

The only problem spot was 5 cups mushrooms. I think intended was 5 cups prechopped? I was using Enoki and others so had to double the rest to match the mushrooms. It worked fine though!
Made this many times. It’s ok for people to tweet
Absolutely delicious! I substituted a leek for the onion, and added shredded carrot.

This worked out well, but I enhanced it a bit. It's not necessary, but I sauted the mushrooms and onions before adding them to the soup for blending. I also added more sherry 1/4 cup and saw another recipe which included gorgonzola cheese which I warmed up when I warmed up the soup and added when we had another serving and it was even better if that is possible. My recommendations is to use a variety of mushrooms of texture (and taste). I also added 1/4 cup of heavy cream and cut back on the half and half. If you add the gorgonzola, you don't really need the heavy cream. It's a rich soup. A cup will do.

This was delish! I used three kinds of mushrooms and added a bit of garlic. Doubled it thank goodness. Wish I had boiled it at the end a few more minutes because it was looser than I would have liked.
This recipe turned out wonderfully. Even though I followed directions but had no sherry, it tasted delicious and I’ll make it again!
Recipe was great and FAST! will def. make again!

I love it! I only changed 2 things just for personal preference. I added garlic and I left more mushrooms and only puréed about 1/4 cup. I just like to taste the mushrooms. This recipe is perfect as is. So like the others said, it’s ok to change a couple things for preference but, don’t change a perfectly good recipe! Makes you never want to eat can soup again!

Good as GF too. I substituted gluten free flour and added a T. of cornstarch for the thickeners. I plan to freeze it so will see how that goes. I'm going to use it in casseroles. This is a much more inexpensive way than buying it in the store too. It''s easy to make too! Thanks!

Made this soup as written. Excellent and flavourful. If you don’t have sherry, you can substitute apple cider vinegar or white wine vinegar. Also... a stick blender makes blending the soup very easy, right in the pot, and allows you greater control over desired consistency. Soup makes 2-3 bowls.

A+ YUMMY! Perfect as is. I am the only one in my house that eats mushrooms, but will use it for other recipes.... since so many people can't handle the texture of mushrooms I do understand why some will change it up a little. I didn't and won't, but won't judge those that do

This was very good but next time don't add salt. It's better for people to add it to their liking. Very yummy!!!!! I added some chopped up red skinned potatoes and it was so good!! Also used evaporated milk instead.
Quick, easy and delicious!! I would make no changes.

I never, never comment on any of these recipes. But this is an exception. WOW! I did everything as in the recipe with only one exception. After running the mushrooms through the food processor, I strained the mushrooms so that I got a broth with no chunks. The leftover mushroom chunks I am going to use for vegan meatballs. This soup is so good I can’t stop eating it.
I've made this soup 3 time now and Love it. Only change I make is eliminating step 2 so it's even easier than the original. My husband and I really enjoy the intact sliced mushrooms.
Easy to make. Delicious and satisfying.
Excellent Cream of Mushroom soup! Easy to make, delicious, and husband-approved!
Loves this and it’s low sodium

I loved this soup! 

I made it exactly as the recipe indicated. (I HATE it when people change everything but the name in a recipe and give it a bad review!)

It was rich, creamy, earthy and filling. I made two batches and froze the leftovers. I've since thawed and eaten some of the containers of the frozen soup, and it tastes just as good as it did the day I made it!
Such an amazing recipe just like it is!!! Perfect. Make it all the time!!

Thank you, Suhansen for your review. I followed your “third time’s the charm” instructions (but used only 4T flour) and it is delicious. I did purée it before adding the cream. Super easy. Will make again.
Added a clove of garlic. Awesome!
The wife loved it so it had to be really good; used mostly the same recipe but threw in some of my Cajon Spice. Yep tis good
It was very easy to make and it was yummy. I had it with toasted sourdough bread and butter
Loved it! Used miso instead of vegetable stock 'cos its whats in the fridge right now.
It was delicious and easy to make!

Followed directions of recipe; adjusted spices at the end. DELICIOUS!! I used Lactaid milk because we can not have dairy. I imagine the flavor with 1/2 and 1/2 would be much richer in flavor. Reminds me of my childhood mushroom soup; so easy to make. No issues with the onions as others have stated.
Excellent! ...and very easy. I didn't have sherry on hand so I used Chardonnay instead. I'm very pleased! Thank you!

Did not purée the vegetables as I mandolined all those beautiful mushrooms...seemed a shame so I sautéed them with the onions in some butter and evoo. The sauce was absolutely delicious as the mushroom let off some of their juice during the sautéing. So, so good. No mention of the half and half so I put it in with the stock before thickening.

-double chicken broth
-double half and half
-double roux
-add 1 tsp paprika
-add 4 stalks chopped green onion

Eh. This was ok. Maybe it would be better if the mushrooms and onion were browned first? Maybe made with beef broth instead of chicken broth and served atop mashed potatoes? Idk. We had it with a salad and French bread, and it reminded us of bad biscuits and gravy.
Easiest soup ever & delicious!
It was decent but not great by any means.

Quite tasty, agree that it is not a pretty soup. Followed recipe as directed except I sautéed the mushrooms & wilted onions. Not complaining but it is a rich soup using butter & half & half really notched it up. I had no sherry but I read that you can use rice vinegar as a substitute, worked out fine.

It came out perfect. The only change I made was (following another person's recommendation). I cooked the onions slightly ahead of the mushrooms in butter and olive oil. Also, I didn't use a blender or food processor.
Easy and excellent soup. Great for the cold weather!!!
EXCELLENT - beyond 5 stars. All I added was a few more tablespoons of the sherry!!!!!!!!

Loved it as is. Took the advice of others and did not totally purée the veggies. Very simple to make. Next time I make it I’m going to try with heavy cream instead of half-and-half and probably double the recipe.
I used regular mushrooms and baby portabello. Very good. Nice appetizer soup.

I used a combo of oyster, shitake, and black trumpet. I followed the recipe as written. this was pretty disgusting. I gave jars to 8 different friends. NOT ONE thought it was good. If you are going to make this, stick with just one kind of mushroom
